Reviews.Title: Compact and Powerful
Reviews.Author: Kenneth
Reviews.Content: This camera is just great. Compact, stylish and powerful. A great deal for the money. 12 MP, HD Video capability, very nice battery life (which by the way is a rechargeable battery that comes with a very comfortable charging dock), the panoramic feature is very good and user friendly. Face and smile detection are also included. The Auto-mode is pretty intuitive and accurate.I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: Tighe White
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that has wide angle, point and shoot, fit in the pocket, fast start up, fast to write to card, inexpensive and decent quality photos. This is good on all points.

Reviews.Title: Come On People
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Fuji cameras, and have been for years.  However...I can't even pretend to like this camera.  It's slow to focus, when it focuses at all.  The images aren't sharp no matter what you do, and the features like blink detection and face recognition barely work, and when they do they're unpredictable and serve no real purpose due to that fact.The Auto Scene mode relies far too heavily on the "Night" scene, causing a drop in resolution and a huge bump in noise, and it also takes the camera forever to decide which mode to use.  Auto mode is too soft and uses too high of an ISO setting, causing major noise.  The only way to get a reliable decent picture is to go into the P mode and lock the ISO at 400 and the resolution at 11MP-2:3 mode.  There is no manual mode.  Even at max megapixels and Fine settings, JPG artifacts abound in finished pictures.The camera does have a metal body, but everything else feels super flimsy and cheesy, from the rattly zoom control and clumsy shutter release that is too trigger happy on half-presses, to the lens cover blades that stick open, and on to the control wheels that rattle around like they're barely attached.I do like the auto panorama mode, as well as the price, but that's not enough for me to recommend this camera.  If you are considering this camera as a cheapie, be warned you likely will not be satisfied with the quality of the pictures considering the learning curve and complexity of the menus.  Move up to a proper Finepix F-series like I did.See the difference in image quality here: [...]

Reviews.Title: An Amazon treasure, Fuji FinPix famous for its quality and ease of use.
Reviews.Author: Arkengareth "Sage"
Reviews.Content: This camera consistently takes fabulous pictures, whether of still subjects or those moving, because there is a sport selection, not to mention the setting to take video pictures, and this camera fits into your pocket!

Reviews.Title: Feels too flimsy...and I just don't like it!!.
Reviews.Author: Woody
Reviews.Content: I've always had Fuji cameras and loved them, so when my last one finally died an honorable death, I didn't even consider looking at something else.  I wanted something small and easy with a couple of bells and whistles, for a decent price...so I chose this camera.  Bad move....  Everything about this camera seems so flimsy and cheap.  It's so light that it's even difficult to get clear shots.  My biggest mistake was purchasing a camera with a Lithium battery.  The thing just doesn't hold a charge.  If you don't have another lithium with you, you're basically done taking pictures.  I prefer to have a camera with AA batteries that can be recharged and if I'm out somewhere and they die, all I have to do is duck into a store for more batteries without having to dish out $15 for a new lithium battery to get me through.  I've tried all the settings, etc. but I am just not happy with the picture quality at all.  Sorry I bought it.

Reviews.Title: EASY to use camera
Reviews.Author: S. Wallace
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that would take good pictures without having to fiddle with it too much.  I get fabulous pictures from this camera.  You can take a lot of pictures if you set it up for small pictures.  These go through the email nicely.  If you want a picture quality good enough to blow up in size without getting fuzzy, this is a good camera.  The large pictures take forever to go through the email but great for family mug-shots you can frame.  More than worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with purchase.
Reviews.Author: Robert G. Norris "Rob Norris"
Reviews.Content: Works great.  I would rather have zoom in/out buttons instead of the little lever but I will get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Small and reasonably good
Reviews.Author: aiv
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a friend. It is quite compact and it takes good pictures and video. It doesn't have much features though, but its quite good to handle and take pictures with switch on time around 3 odd seconds. Overall its a good camera for the price  around $80.-v

Reviews.Title: Best Close Ups
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Aziz
Reviews.Content: I tested this camera in a store and found the close ups in macro to be exceptionally good for a wide angle lens. Fuji has maintained the 4/3 aspect ratio that is essential for good close ups. Many more expensive wide angle compact digital cameras that I own cannot take good close ups in macro setting, which are very important to me. Perhaps the best camera out there in the lower price point.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm camera
Reviews.Author: Teriann
Reviews.Content: I love the camera...it was delivered on time however; it did not have a fujifilm battery in it.  I felt if I was purchasing a new camera...it should at least have had the correct battery in it.  Other than that small error...I am totally pleased!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my old Fuji...
Reviews.Author: C. Ellis "sliders7"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the having an older Fuji FinePix camera. I loved that one. I kinda abuse it though as I took it to the field alot while I was a Drill Sergeant at Fort Jackson. It took the abuse for about a year and half and then gave up. I was impress. So I saw this one and ordered it. The pics aren't as sharp and the camera doesn't have the same feel. It doesn't focus as quickly either but overall a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: A Middle Of The Road Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed Fuji cameras in the past so I purchased this item as something my wife could take with her and easily slip in her pocket or purse.Pros:Small / CompactNice colorsHas HD videoNice, not excellent, image qualityCons:Very cheaply madeThe autofocus motor is very loudTends to overexpose imagesAll in all, it is a good value at this price and my wife likes it.  If you want something with excellet image quality, I would look at stepping up to their F or S series cameras.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera but Complex
Reviews.Author: Dyetlady "Sunny"
Reviews.Content: Camera was a good buy but kind of complex for a novice. Had all kinds of crazy icons visible when I went to take pictures that I could not decipher, even in Auto setting.  Had to call the company to find out what they meant.  Still cant figure out how to engage the flash. It has advanced features like recognizing when someone blinks or is not smiling. Menu is hard to navigate. Instruction book not adequate. This being said, it does take an excellent picture and software can be used on Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: low price for compact
Reviews.Author: rbass
Reviews.Content: good camera, compact, lightweight, slim is a good option for those looking for a pocket camera to always carry to any place without taking up much space, you can even bring the pocket

ProductInfo.Features:
12.2 megapixels
Storage media Internal memory (Approx. 24MB) or optional SD or SDHC memory card recommended
Number of recorded pixels Still image - 4,000 x 3,000 (12M, 4 - 3 format) / 4,000 x 2,664 (11M, 3 - 2 format) / 4,000 x 2,248 (9M, 16 - 9 format)
Up to 1280x720 for 720p YV Movie mode - with or without sound
Fujinon 5x optical zoom lens, F3.6 (Wide) - F5.9 (Telephoto) with Lens focal length f=5.0 - 25.0mm, equivalent to 28 - 140mm on a 35mm camera
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix JX200 - Digital camera - compact - 12.0 Mpix - optical zoom: 5 x - supported memory: SD, SDHC - black
